answers.answer: Hi,How are you? The surgical repair of retinal detachments is usually successful and may take several months before vision returns to its final level. However, the final outcome for vision depends on several factors and close follow-up by an ophthalmologist  is required. If it has been 11 months already, you may benefit from seeking another doctor's opinion for proper evaluation. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: Should I get a 2nd opinion? I am 11 months post surgery for retinal detachment. Recent return visit to retinal surgeon as well as ophthalmologist show vision loss the past 3 months. I am a 65 year old male, active, no diabetes, had unusual sugar spikes (now stable), blood pressure and cholesterol managed with medications, take Celebrex for arthritis daily.
title: Should I get a 2nd opinion for vision loss post retinal surgery (11 months post)?
